subject: Re: [junit] Article That Should Help Testing: "Five Habits of Highly Profitable Software Dev
msgSnippet: ... I think they belong in a template method, myself. ... I would argue that. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca Your guide to software
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
>
>
> On 8/24/06, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...
> <mailto:elharo%40metalab.unc.edu>> wrote:
> >
> >
> > However this can conflict with your response to point 1. What if a
> > constructor needs to open a file? And for that matter why do files have
> > to be opened anyway? Perhaps file writes and reads should auto-open and
> > close files as necessary.
>
> Yes. Operations that need to be mirrored (opening/closing) probably don't
> belong in the constructor since Java doesn't give us an obvious
> counterpart.

I think they belong in a template method, myself.

> Pushing this point further, seeing an operation that requires later clean up
> in a constructor could arguably be seen as a design smell...

I would argue that.
